# How to Manage Fusion Set Security Templates iOS/Android

Last updated May 28, 2024 by Appdome

This Knowledge Base article provides step-by-step instructions for **managing** Fusion Sets on Appdome as part of your release management process.

## What are Fusion Sets?

[Fusion Sets](https://www.appdome.com/how-to/dev-sec-tools/app-sec-release-automation/build-security-template-android-ios-apps/) are pre-built, reusable, sharable mobile app security templates that contain all the selected security features, settings, options and configurations that Appdome builds into your iOS and Android apps whenever you click Build My App. Fusion Sets accelerate and automate mobile security implementations, ensure implementation consistency, and reduce integration time for each build or release of your mobile apps.

## Playground Fusion Set

Whenever you upload a mobile app to Appdome, a default Playground Fusion Set is created for each app. The Playground Fusion Set is not shared and affects only the app it was created for. Below is an example of a Playground Fusion Set.  
![Fusion Set 1](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/08/Fusion-Set-1.png)

## **How to Manage Fusion Sets (Security Templates)**

Once a Fusion Set is created, there are several different actions you can take as part of managing the Fusion Set through its lifecycle.

* + **Create** a new blank Fusion Set.
  + **Select** the Fusion Set you want to use by clicking on its row in the drop-down.
  + **Copy** an existing Fusion Set, which you can then rename, change, and share.
  + **Open** the Fusion Sets drop-down.
  + **Subscribe** all apps to the Fusion Set. This feature saves significant time because you do not need to manually subscribe each app to the Fusion Set one by one.
  + **View details** of the Fusion Set, such as who created it, creation date, including all apps subscribed to the Fusion Set and more.
  + **Export** the Fusion Set as a JSON file
  + [**Freeze Fusion Set**](https://www.appdome.com/how-to/dev-sec-tools/app-sec-release-automation/freeze-fusion-set-security-templates/) – locks the Fusion Set so that it cannot be changed by others.
  + **Delete** Fusion Set – if you no longer need it

### Create a New Fusion Set

Click “**Create New Fusion Set**” to create a new blank Fusion Set.  
![Set Fusion Set Name](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/08/Set-Fusion-Set-Name.png)

Enter a name in the text box, and click **Save**.  
![Fusion Set Name](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/08/Fusion-Set-Name.png)

### Copying a Fusion Set

You can make a copy of the Playground Fusion Set to share with another team.

* Hover on the Playground Fusion Set, and click on the **Copy** button.  
  ![Copy Fusion Set](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/08/Copy-Fusion-Set-e1716825046154.png)

### Subscribe all apps to the Fusion Set

![Subscribe All Apps To This Fs](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/08/Subscribe-all-apps-to-this-FS.png)

### View Fusion Set Details

* Edit Fusion Set Name
* [Freeze Fusion Set](https://www.appdome.com/how-to/devsecops-automation-mobile-cicd/cyber-release-management/freeze-lock-moible-app-protection-templates-for-android-ios-rcs-in-devsecops-build-system/)
* Export Fusion Set as JSON file  
  ![Fusion Set Details](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/08/Fusion-Set-Details-e1716824896592.png)![Fs Details](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/08/FS-Details.png)

In order to save time for users, Appdome automatically updates every account subscribed to a specific Fusion Set upon each change. So, if you enable a setting in an app subscribed to a Fusion Set, every app that’s subscribed to the same Fusion Set will be updated as well.

### Export and Compare Fusion Sets between Teams

When collaborating within an Appdome team, multiple people may work on the same Fusion Set—one creates it, someone else signs it, etc. You will probably want to review any changes committed to the Fusion Set, and you can do that by exporting its settings as a JSON file.

Even when working alone, you can compare your different Fusion Sets and monitor your work.

To **Export** Fusion Set settings:

* **Click the meatballs menu icon** to review the Fusion Set details.
* For more details on how to share fusion sets between teams, see [How to Release Fusion Set Templates Between Teams in a DevSecOps Build System](https://www.appdome.com/how-to/devsecops-automation-mobile-cicd/cyber-release-management/release-mobile-app-protection-templates-between-teams-in-devsecops-build-system/)  
  ![Release Fs Between Teams](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/08/Release-FS-between-teams-1.png)

### Delete a Fusion Set

![Delete Fs](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/08/Delete-FS.png)
